results.content: Well done course. The only think I would add is a more detailed descriptions of the syntax employed in the project especially for those of us that don't know much about things like Promises.

results.content:
This is really concise information. A few errors were made in the destructuring video, but other than that... there were no annoying flaws to be found. I wish every course on Udemy was like this.

I 1.5x speed it and plow through it in a jiffy. A few hours later, I've learned a new skill!
results.content_html:
This is really concise information. A few errors were made in the destructuring video, but other than that... there were no annoying flaws to be found. I wish every course on Udemy was like this.

I 1.5x speed it and plow through it in a jiffy. A few hours later, I've learned a new skill!

results.content: Great information and pretty clear. There were a couple of mistakes made in the class inheritance section that should be corrected. Also in the last section where we are setting up the final project tsd is used to pull in some typing information and tsd no longer seems to be supported. If these were corrected I would give a higher rating.
results.content_html: Great information and pretty clear. There were a couple of mistakes made in the class inheritance section that should be corrected. Also in the last section where we are setting up the final project tsd is used to pull in some typing information and tsd no longer seems to be supported. If these were corrected I would give a higher rating.

results.content:
Pretty good walk through of basic features of TypeScript. Could have done without going through the process of setting up a new folder/file in every single lecture slide. Seems like this could have been avoided.

There was a lecture  Class Inheritance which  bugged me. The instructor made a mistake but instead of figuring out what it was and maybe redoing the lecture they just hacked around it. They were trying to demonstrate how to extend a subclass with a method and ended up adding the method which was supposed to be on the super class to the sub class to just get it running. This kind of defeats the whole purpose of the example. Seemed a little unprofessional to just hack around it to get it working......
results.content_html:

This kind of defeats the whole purpose of the example. Seemed a little unprofessional to just hack around it to get it working......
